title: Two Sum
description:
Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `target`, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to `target`.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

Input Format:
First line contains N, the number of elements.
Second line contains N space-separated integers.
Third line contains the target.

Output Format:
Two space-separated indices in increasing order.

starterCode.python:
import sys

def solve():
    lines = sys.stdin.read().splitlines()
    n = int(lines[0])
    nums = list(map(int, lines[1].split()))
    target = int(lines[2])
    
    # Your code here
    # print(f"{i} {j}")

solve()

title: Valid Palindrome
description:
Given a string S, output "true" if it is a palindrome, or "false" otherwise. Considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.

Input Format:
A single line containing the string S.

Output Format:
"true" or "false"

starterCode.python:
import sys

s = sys.stdin.read().strip()
# Your code here

testCases.input: A man, a plan, a canal: Panama

title: Sum of Array
description:
Given an array of integers, find the sum of its elements.

Input Format:
Line 1: N (size of array)
Line 2: N space separated integers

Output Format:
Single integer representing the sum.

starterCode.python:
import sys
input = sys.stdin.read
data = input().split()
N = int(data[0])
arr = map(int, data[1:])
print(sum(arr))

title: Factorial
description:
Calculate the factorial of a non-negative integer N.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
The factorial of N.

title: Reverse String
description:
Write a program that takes a string as input and prints the reverse of the string.

Input Format:
A single string.

Output Format:
The reversed string.

title: Check Odd or Even
description:
Given an integer N, print "Odd" if it is odd, and "Even" if it is even.

Input:
Single integer N.

Output:
"Odd" or "Even".

title: Maximum of Two Numbers
description:
Given two integers A and B, print the maximum of the two.

Input:
Two space separated integers A and B.

Output:
The maximum value.

title: Fibonacci Number
description:
The Fibonacci numbers, commonly denoted F(n) form a sequence, called the Fibonacci sequence, such that each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, starting from 0 and 1. Calculate F(n).

Input:
Integer n.

Output:
Integer F(n).

title: Prime Checker
description:
Check if a number N is prime. Print "Yes" if prime, "No" otherwise.

Input:
Integer N.

Output:
"Yes" or "No".

title: FizzBuzz
description:
Given an integer n, for every integer i from 1 to n, print:
"FizzBuzz" if i is divisible by 3 and 5.
"Fizz" if i is divisible by 3.
"Buzz" if i is divisible by 5.
Otherwise print i.
Print each on a new line.

Input:
Integer n.

Output:
Check description.

title: Power of Two
description:
Given an integer n, return "true" if it is a power of two. Otherwise, return "false".

Input:
Integer n.

Output:
"true" or "false".

title: Missing Number
description:
Given an array containing n distinct numbers taken from 0, 1, 2, ..., n, find the one that is missing from the array.

Input:
Line 1: n
Line 2: n space separated integers

Output:
The missing integer.

title: Linear Search
description:
Given an array and a target value x, print the index of x if found, else -1.

Input:
Line 1: n (size)
Line 2: n integers
Line 3: target x

Output:
Index or -1.

title: Binary Search
description:
Given a sorted array of distinct integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return -1. Time complexity should be O(log n).

Input:
Line 1: N
Line 2: N sorted integers
Line 3: Target

Output:
Index or -1.

title: Valid Parentheses
description:
Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

Input:
String s.

Output:
"true" or "false".

title: Climbing Stairs
description:
You are climbing a staircase. It takes n steps to reach the top. Each time you can either climb 1 or 2 steps. In how many distinct ways can you climb to the top?

Input:
Integer n.

Output:
Ways.

title: Single Number
description:
Given a non-empty array of integers nums, every element appears twice except for one. Find that single one.

Input:
Line 1: n
Line 2: n integers

Output:
The single number.

title: Majority Element
description:
Given an array `nums` of size `n`, return the majority element. The majority element is the element that appears more than `⌊n / 2⌋` times.

Input:
Line 1: n
Line 2: n integers

Output:
Majority Element.

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
description:
You are given an array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day. You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different day in the future to sell that stock. Return the maximum profit you can achieve from this transaction. If you cannot achieve any profit, return 0.

Input:
Line 1: n
Line 2: n prices

Output:
Max profit.

title: Length of Last Word
description:
Given a string s consisting of words and spaces, return the length of the last word in the string.

Input:
String s.

Output:
Length.
